Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery kylix: interior: red-figure decoration consisting of nude athlete (only one leg and hands remaining) bending to right, probably to pick up jumping-weights, which may just be preserved at break; exterior black; one repair hole preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 48, pl. XXVII, no. 7)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 509, no. C71)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1463)
